title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that no, Kareem would not be able to buy 3 units of Good X and 5 units of cereal and/or does not explain that his total expenditures would be $26 (=$2×3+$4×5) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaai aacIcacqGH9aqpcaGGKaGaaGOmaiabgEna0kaaiodacqGHRaWkcaGG KaGaaGinaiabgEna0kaaiwdacaGGPaaaaa@43AE@ , which is greater than his weekly income of $18.

The response states that no, Kareem would not be able to buy 3 units of Good X and 5 units of cereal and explains that his total expenditures would be $26 (=$2×3+$4×5) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaai aacIcacqGH9aqpcaGGKaGaaGOmaiabgEna0kaaiodacqGHRaWkcaGG KaGaaGinaiabgEna0kaaiwdacaGGPaaaaa@43AE@ , which is greater than his weekly income of $18.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the total consumer surplus as $44 and/or does not show the work.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify 3 units of Good X and 3 units of cereal will maximize Kareem’s total benefit given his weekly income of $18 and/or does not explain that for the last unit of each good consumed the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of Good X (6) is equal to the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of cereal (6), or

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does none of the following:

· States that the quantity of Good X that will maximize Kareem’s total benefit will increase and explains that a decrease in the number of consumers in the market for Good X will decrease the demand for Good X, which will decrease the price of Good X and increase the marginal benefit per dollar spent that Kareem gets from each additional unit of the good.

· States that Kareem’s total consumer surplus would increase and explains that a decrease in the price of Good X would decrease the total cost of consuming 4 units of Good X while the total benefit of consuming 4 units of cereal remains the same.

The response does one of the following:

· States that the quantity of Good X that will maximize Kareem’s total benefit will increase and explains that a decrease in the number of consumers in the market for Good X will decrease the demand for Good X, which will decrease the price of Good X and increase the marginal benefit per dollar spent that Kareem gets from each additional unit of the good.

· States that Kareem’s total consumer surplus would increase and explains that a decrease in the price of Good X would decrease the total cost of consuming 4 units of Good X while the total benefit of consuming 4 units of cereal remains the same.

The response does both of the following:

· States that the quantity of Good X that will maximize Kareem’s total benefit will increase and explains that a decrease in the number of consumers in the market for Good X will decrease the demand for Good X, which will decrease the price of Good X and increase the marginal benefit per dollar spent that Kareem gets from each additional unit of the good.

· States that Kareem’s total consumer surplus would increase and explains that a decrease in the price of Good X would decrease the total cost of consuming 4 units of Good X while the total benefit of consuming 4 units of cereal remains the same.
